title: Incandescent Glow

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How are we doing for time, Janaff?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: They're gaining on us. Their lead force is about...let's say...one day off.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You've got to be kidding! How did they cover so much ground since yesterday?!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: They're definitely moving faster than we expected. At this rate, they'll catch us soon. Any ideas?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...With the enemy closing in so quickly, it would be unwise to use this secret passage. If Begnion found it, it would give them an open invitation to surge across Gallia. Your kind would not be pleased.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: We can't expose our country to that danger. We have to think of something else.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, we can't start a fight in the Serenes Forest. Besides the terrain disadvantage, the forest isn't fully healed, and we can't risk burning it down again. Soren, any ideas?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Our options are profoundly limited, Ike. It appears our only other choice is those caves up ahead.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Caves? Oh...yeah, those are the Kauku Caves. We don't want to go there. It's a complex maze, full of lava and ash. Not exactly a place you'd want to rest. The legends say that, through the caves, there's one exit that leads to Gallia, and another exit that leads to Goldoa. Whatever the legends say, though, the fact is that it's suicide to go in there. We don't even have a map!

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: However, the more you hens carry on, the closer the enemy advances on us. They're now less than a day away.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: If the enemy catches up to us in this forest, we will certainly die. The caves are known to be dangerous, so Begnion may not pursue. Even the most formidable natural hazard isn't as deadly as an intelligent, living enemy. We must go to the caves. Now.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, Soren. I trust you. Let's move out for the caves.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Are you sure? We have visual confirmation of the Laguz Alliance heading into the Kauku Caves?

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: Yes, sir. The enemy must be desperate. Why else would they enter that forsaken death trap?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: We cannot go there without preparation. It would be suicide. Let's not follow them to their deaths. ...That ends our pursuit, then. Tell the men that this mission is over.
I cannot allow you to do that, my dear General.

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: You're--!

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Senator Valtome.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Uwee hee hee. You're not even a tiny bit surprised, Lord Zelgius of Cador? What a frightful bore you are. I came here in secret just to surprise you.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Oh, I am surprised indeed. What would bring a senator of your station to a place like this? Do you bring new orders?

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Uwee hee hee. Oh, yes. I am here to deliver a decision handed down by the senate. In its wisdom, the senate has appointed me commander in chief of the Imperial Army. From this moment on, this army is mine.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: ...I see. Then I am at your command. Your orders, Commander?

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Uwee hee hee. Oh, you are ever so serious! You haven't changed one bit, Zelgius. One of these days, I will catch you off guard. Well, I suppose that impassive face of yours is just part of your charm.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: ...Senator Valtome. Your orders.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Oh, yes, orders. Hmm, well, this battle is taking far too long for my taste. We will pull back and conquer Gallia by taking a different path.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I see. Then I shall inform my men.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: The northern force will stay here. Tell them to go inside the caves and search for bodies of dead sub-humans or something.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: What?! Sending them into those caves is the same as sending them to the gallows. I implore you to reconsider, Commander.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: I gave my order, did I not? Get those men in those caves right this minute! And, Zelgius? Never question my orders again, or I'll have you killed. Is that clear? Besides, you should be happy. You're coming with me to finally wipe out those beasts. Come along now.

intro.speaker: Septimus
intro.line: Why... Why do I always get stuck with these awful missions? I should have curried favor with General Zelgius! Then perhaps I wouldn't have had to step into these ghastly caves...

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Hey, Ike! We have company.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Seems that way. What kind of numbers are we looking at? I can't see through all this smoke and heat.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: It's just like Soren said: a token force.

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: As far as I can tell, Zelgius isn't leading them. That helps things.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We have to keep the enemy away from Skrimir? And the others while they look for an exit. Let's proceed as planned. We have enough people here to deal with these clowns. Everyone ready?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: We're set. Let's finish this and get out of here!

boss.speaker: Septimus
boss.line: They told me that the enemy would be burnt by the time I reached them. The only thing I'd have to do was carry their dead bodies back as proof... It's just my luck that the enemy is alive and well! Why does this always happen to me?

boss.speaker: Septimus
boss.line: AHHH! Th-they're here! Th-th-the sub-humans! The mongrels are here! They want to consume me!

boss.speaker: Septimus
boss.line: I-I knew it... I knew I would end up like this...

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: Ike of the Greil Mercenaries. You don't look too good. Maybe you should just leave...

boss.speaker: Septimus
boss.line: Wait a moment... HAH! Look, everyone! Look at this one! He's not a beast! Oh, thank the goddess! Victory is nigh!

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: So... Chasing us into these caves wasn't the plum assignment that all the best generals wanted, huh?

boss.speaker: Septimus
boss.line: How DARE you! Take my spear, knave!

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Ike, Ranulf! This way! I found a way out.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Excellent! Let's get out of here!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You don't have to tell me twice.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Yes! We did it! We made it through the caves!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Looks like we finally lost the Begnion army, as well. We can finally rest a bit.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: I thought we were finished... I thought my rashness had killed us. But we've lived to see our land again!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Hey, Skrimir. Has all the heat gone to that shaggy head of yours? Look around. Is this Gallia?

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: ...What?! No! We can't be in--

end.speaker: Goldoa
end.line: You! By whose authority have you entered this land?!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Goldoa, the land of the dragons... By the goddess, did we mess up.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: The dragons... It is said they are the most powerful of all the laguz tribes. I've always wanted to fight a dragon, but I never expected it would happen like this... When our king finds out about this, I will have much explaining to do.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: You've got to get home first, Skrimir. I guess we have to pay that stubborn old lizard a visit, don't we?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Let's go.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: ...And there you have it. We never intended to violate Goldoa's borders. It was an accident.

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: I see... I understand your predicament. However, your reasons neither justify nor change the fact that you trespassed on our territory. I order you to leave immediately. Go back the way you came, through the caves.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: You would have us go through Kauku Caves again?! Never!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Stop talking, Skrimir!

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Many of my men are wounded! You're sending them to their deaths! I will not allow this!

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: It is regrettable, yes. However, I cannot make exceptions. Your men will leave. Now.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: How could a laguz be so cold to his brothers? We are your people as well!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: This isn't news, Skrimir. Goldoa and its lizards have ignored the suffering of their laguz brothers for centuries. They even looked the other way while we birds and beasts were enslaved by beorc! Isn't that so, Dragon King?

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: ...Our country is neutral. It has been since time out of mind and will continue to be so.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Then you might as well just kill us now. It'd be the same as sending us back to the Kauku Caves, and it saves us the walk.

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: You are a beorc. I would not expect your short-lived kind to understand.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I don't need to understand to see that it's a poor king who has so little regard for his fellow living creatures!

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: Hmm...

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: ...Your Majesty! Please hear our plea!

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: What are you two doing here?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Please allow my grandfather and me to guide the Laguz Alliance to the borders of Gallia. I beg of you.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Prince Reyson of the heron tribe stands among these men. The dragon tribe owes him safe passage. Please, Your Majesty! He saved the soul of your son! Would you condemn them to die, despite the good they've done?

end.speaker: Dheginsea
end.line: ...Hmph. Do as you like. This is the only exception I will ever make.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Thank you, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Well, here you are. I think you know the way from here.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Thanks, Nasir. You really saved us back there.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: It's the least we could do. I will pray for your safety.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hey, wait up, you two!  We haven't seen you in a long time. Don't you have some time to stay and talk with us for a little while?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: A long time? What do you mean? We just saw you three years ago!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh, that's right... Three years isn't all that long for you dragons, is it?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Oh, I'm sorry. I suppose three years would feel slightly longer for beorc.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Ike. I would love to stay and talk, but now is not the proper time. In truth, we are not even allowed to speak with you at all. Now, please go.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Why? Why do you isolate yourselves from everyone?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: ...I don't expect you to understand. But I want you to know that we obey our king's decision of our own free will. That's all I can say.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir...

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: You should go. Many of your wounded need immediate attention. Head back to Gallia at once, and tell the lion king what happened.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right... I don't get it, but I'll go now. We'll see each other again?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I certainly hope so. You are one of our dearest friends.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Take care, and be safe.

narration: Goldoa, the land of dragons, lies secluded in the southwestern corner of Tellius. No foreigner, laguz, or beorc, is permitted within its borders.

The alliance emerges from the lava tubes and into Goldoa by accident. The dragon king, Dheginsea, is displeased by this trespass. However, Ike's former companions Nasir and Ena appeal to Dheginsea to allow the passage of the Laguz Alliance. Reyson's actions during the last war earn them the grudging respect of King Dheginsea, who allows them safe passage.

Meanwhile, Begnion calls off its pursuit of the alliance and finds its passage into Gallia blocked by the nation's great mountains and deep forests. The Central Army's momentum breaks upon these obstacles like an ocean wave against solid rock. Senator Valtome arrives to take command of the Central Army. He orders Zelgius to march on to Gallia by way of Crimea. Observing diplomatic protocol, Valtome petitions the queen for passage as well as supplies and additional troops.

Queen Elincia, however, goes against the wishes of the Crimean nobles and resolutely denies each of Valtome's requests. Her reply enrages Valtome, who sees Crimea as little more than a vassal of the empire. Ignoring Zelgius's counsel, Valtome orders his army to enter Crimea and take whatever they need from the villages along the way.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: How are the injured holding up?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: They’re exhausted. Some are so bad off they can’t even get up the energy to transform. The unwounded soldiers have been taking turns carrying the injured.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: That’s a good idea. Maybe I’ll carry one or two on my back once we enter the caves.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Hey, you’re hurt, too. Be careful you don’t strain yourself and cause permanent injury, all right?

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Hurt? Do I look like I’ve been wounded?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Skrimir, you’re standing in a pool of your own blood. Tell me the truth. It hurts to even stand, right?

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: ...A little. Do the others know?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: No. None of our soldiers do. But I’m sure King Tibarn and Ike both know.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Good. Our soldiers shouldn’t know. I have to be their role model! They’ll see that I’ve been wounded yet continue to fight. Maybe that will help them carry on.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Skrimir...

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Lyre, come on. You have to stop sulking.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Don’t talk to me! I hate you, Lethe!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: That’s too bad, because I like you.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Liar.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: I’m only hard on you because I worry about you, and I want you to stay safe. Why did you even become a soldier? You used to hate fighting.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Hmph.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Was it because of Ranulf?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: That was one reason, I guess.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: There were other reasons?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Yeah. I wanted to stay with you.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: ...Does that mean you’ll start talking to me again?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Yeah. Even though you drive me crazy, you’re still my sister!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: I’m glad.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Here. Take this as a token of apology.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: It’s a Daunt scroll. I thought it’d be perfect for someone as scary as you!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: What!? Say that again, I dare you!

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Aaahh! Lethe’s mad at me again! Stop being mean to me!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: I’m the mean one!?
